meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points of equal underwater depth.
meanings.sent1: The isobath on the map shows where the underwater depth is the same.
meanings.sent2: The sailors used the isobath to navigate through the deep sea.
meanings.sent3: The fish were confused by the isobath on the map, thinking it was a new type of seaweed.
meanings.sent4: The isobath acted like a secret code, revealing the hidden depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The isobath painted a clear picture of the underwater landscape for the researchers.

meanings.definition: A contour line on a map connecting points of equal depth below the surface of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The isobath helped the divers understand the underwater topography.
meanings.sent2: The map's isobath indicated where the lake had consistent depth.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the isobath was a magical bridge to an underwater kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The isobath was like a thread weaving through the fabric of the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The isobath was a lifeline for the sailors, guiding them safely through the deep waters.
